is a spiritual teacher and writer who is
known for his teachings on mindfulness
in the power of present moment awareness
Tolle emphasizes the importance of
living in the present moment and of
letting go of negative thoughts and
feelings from the past or worrying about
the future according to Tully this can
lead to sense of inner peace and
contentment his teachings often involve
a focus on the present moment in the
idea that all human suffering is
ultimately due to a lack of connection
to the present moment in 1997 Eckhart
Tolle published his first book The Power
of Now since that time it has gone on to
become a global bestseller with millions
of copies sold worldwide the book has
been translated into over 50 languages
and has received widespread critical
Acclaim The Power of Now established
Eckhart Tolle as one of the most
well-known spiritual teachers of our
time The Power of Now communicates one
very simple all yet powerful message
relaxed thoughts about the past and the
future and rest in the present moment
one of the key reasons for the book's
success is its ability to speak to
people from all walks of life the
concepts it presents such as mindfulness
and the power of present moment
awareness are Universal and can be
applied to anyone's life regardless of
their background or circumstances also
the book is written in a clear
straightforward style that is easy to
understand making it accessible to a
wide audience the book's message has
resonated deeply with many readers many
many people have reported experiencing
incredible improvements not only in
their mental well-being as a result of

enjoyed significant improvements in
their overall quality of life but who is

Beyond The Power of Now
Eckhart Tolle was born in Germany in
1948 according to Tully he had a
difficult upbringing and struggled with
depression and a sense of disconnection
from the world for much of his early
life at 13 years old he moved to Spain
to live with his father Tully's father
did not force him to go to school so
tolly stayed home and began to study
literature astronomy and languages at 15
years old Tyler was given a set of five
books written by the German artist in
Mystic Joseph Anton Schneider Franken
Schneider Franken was later known by his
spiritual name boy in ra his teaching
focused on the power of the individual
to shape their own destiny Bo Yun Ra's
ideas were very influential in the
development of the new thought movement
similar to The Law of Attraction which
emphasizes the power of positive
thinking and the ability of individuals
to create their own reality through the
power of their thoughts and beliefs
Tully said that the reading of these

this time I did well because I was
motivated by fear of not being good

on to enroll in a postgraduate program
at Cambridge University intending to

a year and dropped out feeling that it
was all meaningless by the time he was
29 years old Tully was suffering from

the underlying structure of the thoughts
that fueled his depression that
structure was this I said to myself in

the profound effectiveness of Eckhart
Tolle's teachings can also be explained
by the most recent findings in
Neuroscience as we have seen Eckhart
Tolle explores the relationship between
the human mind and the present moment
and how the internal dialogue of I said
to myself creates virtual worlds of past
and future preventing us from fully
experiencing the present moment Tully's
teachings on the part of the present
moment are philosophical and spiritual
innate however science now has come to
some very similar conclusions Recent
research in Neuroscience has shed light
on the ways in which the brain and the
mind interact with the present moment
and how mindfulness practices can have a
positive impact on our mental and
physical well-being Neuroscience now
supports the idea that mindfulness
practices such as letting go of the
internal I said to myself dialogue can
have a profoundly positive impact on the
brain and the mind for example Studies
have shown that mindfulness practices
can increase activity in the prefrontal
cortex which is responsible for
attention and decision making and reduce
activity in the amygdala which is
responsible for the stress response
these changes in brain activity have
been linked to improved emotional
regulation and a reduction in Stress and
Anxiety letting go of the internal
dialogue and thus becoming more present
has been shown to increase the
production of neurotransmitters such as
serotonin endopamine which are involved
in feelings of well-being and
Neuroscience also points to the two
brain networks involved in cognitive
processing understanding these two brain
networks helps to reveal what is
happening in the brain when we are blind
to the present moment because we are
captured by the internal dialogue of I
said to myself these two networks are
the default mode Network dmn and the
task positive Network tpn the default
mode network is that part of the brain
that is active when we are not involved
in a task the default mode network is
active when we are involved in thinking
about the past or future or involved in
self-reflection I.E thinking about
ourselves the default mode network is
especially active when we are involved
in the internal I said to myself
dialogue the task positive network is
that part of the brain that is active
when we are involved in a task the task
positive network is that part of the
brain that is active when we are present
to what is happening in the moment if
both brain networks are working well
together when one network is active the
other will go quiet for example if
you're working on a very difficult maths
problem or even deeply involved in a
video game the default mode network of
self-reflection will go quiet and the
task positive network will take over
this is what we experience when we lose
ourselves in a game activity music sport
or other similar activity however for
some people especially those suffering
from ADHD or similar neurological
problems the default mode Network never
quietens down this can be true for many
people even if they are not ADHD for
example you try and concentrate on a
task and your mind keeps taking you away
from it with internal dialogue I.E
default mode Network what Eckhart Tolle
and other spiritual traditions
suggesting from the neurological point
of view is to begin to become aware of
the constant internal dialogue of the
default mode network and to consciously
relax that Network and therefore allow
the task positive Network to become
active in other words by relaxing the I
said to myself dialogue you will become
more present to the contents and tasks
of the moment and thus in most cases
much more effective in your life
interestingly when the default mode
network is completely turned off as in
sleep or unconsciousness the task
positive network will often continue its
work on completing a task or coming up
with a solution to a problem this is why
many are scientist or a writer will
report that it was when they stopped
trying to come up with a solution to the
formula or plot point and had a shower
or had a nap the solution suddenly
popped into their heads this
neurological understanding of how
relaxing the default mode Network work
internal dialogue of I said to myself
and allowing the offline completing
power of the task positive Network may
also explain the strong suggestion of
many spiritual traditions in times of
extreme crisis to let go and let God or
to Simply surrender it may also explain
why organizations such as Alcoholic
Anonymous have had such success in
overcoming addictive patterns by
suggesting to their members they
surrender to their higher power Eckhart
Tolle's suggestion is to direct
attention away from thought and to what
is active or present in the moment this
is also a definition of surrender one of
his primary suggestions is to direct
attention away from thought to either
the internal energetic feeling of the
body or to any external object appearing
to awareness this can be very helpful in
quieting the internal dialogue of I said
to myself and thus returning us to the
pure and easy Simplicity I and has seen
accomplishing power of the present
moment however as we more and more relax
our internal dialogue and rest in the
present moment we soon experience a
profound deepening we go beyond
